easel.ui

Enum AnchorPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<AnchorPosition>
      • easel.ui.AnchorPosition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<AnchorPosition>

    public enum AnchorPosition
extends java.lang.Enum<AnchorPosition>
    Enum specifying nine anchorable positions which are mostly used for aligning widgets into the proper location. Contains some helper methods to make working with the anchors a bit easier.

    • Enum Constant Summary

        Returns true if the anchor is horizontally left.
        Returns:
        true if this is LEFT_TOP, LEFT_CENTER, or LEFT_BOTTOM

        public boolean isBottom()

        public boolean isTop()
        Returns true if the anchor is vertically top.
        Returns:
        true if this is LEFT_TOP, CENTER_TOP, or RIGHT_TOP

      • isCenterX

        public boolean isCenterX()
        Returns true if the anchor is horizontally centered.
        Returns:
        true if this is CENTER_TOP, CENTER, or CENTER_BOTTOM

      • isCenterY

        public boolean isCenterY()
        Returns true if the anchor is vertically centered.
        Returns:
        true if this is LEFT_CENTER, CENTER, or RIGHT_CENTER

      • getXFromLeft

        public float getXFromLeft(float left,
                          float width)
        Computes an x value adjusted by this anchor, given a leftmost point and the width of the area. If the anchor is LEFT_*, the returned x is just the left point. If the anchor is CENTER_*, the returned x is the left plus half the width. Otherwise, returns the rightmost point (computed by the left + width).
        Parameters:
        left - leftmost point of the region to anchor into
        width - width of the region to anchor into
        Returns:
        an x coordinate contained inside the region [left, left + width] with the horizontal position determined by this anchor

      • getXFromRight

        public float getXFromRight(float right,
                           float width)
        Similar to getXFromLeft(float, float), except the range is inside [right - width, right].
        Parameters:
        right - rightmost point of the region to anchor into
        width - width of the region to anchor into
        Returns:
        an x coordinate contained inside the region [right - width, right] with the horizontal position determined by this anchor
        See Also:
        getXFromLeft(float, float)

      • getYFromBottom

        public float getYFromBottom(float bottom,
                            float height)
        Computes a y value adjusted by this anchor, given a bottom point and the height of the area. If the anchor is *_BOTTOM, the returned y is just the bottom point. If the anchor is *_CENTER, the returned y is the bottom plus half the height. Otherwise, returns the topmost point (computed by the bottom + height).
        Parameters:
        bottom - lowest point of the region to anchor into
        height - height of the region to anchor into
        Returns:
        a y coordinate contained inside the region [bottom, bottom + height] with the vertical position determined by this anchor

      • getYFromTop

        public float getYFromTop(float top,
                         float height)
        Similar to getYFromBottom(float, float), except the range is inside [top - height, top].
        Parameters:
        top - highest point of the region to anchor into
        height - height of the region to anchor into
        Returns:
        a y coordinate contained inside the region [top - height, top] with the vertical position determined by this anchor
        See Also:
        getYFromBottom(float, float)
